options.help: ## Replacing a vehicle with a new vehicle To qualify for standard replacement the vehicle must have been identified during the yearly replacement planning process as eligible for replacement To be eligible for standard replacement the current vehicle has to exceed or will exceed km during the upcoming replacement year Please remember to fill out the box in Section Delivery Location so that Fleet Management Services may know where to arrange the delivery of the replacement new vehicle and the surplus declaration of the vehicle being replaced

## Requesting a net new vehicle with no direct replacement Acceptable criteria for a net new vehicle is a minimum of km per year Any new addition to the fleet requires a business case and Assistant Deputy Minister approval The Additional Vehicle Questionnaire needs to be completed and approved prior to the Vehicle Order Form Additional Replacements require signatures in the following order Ministry Vehicle Coordinator or equivalent Fleet Management Services E Ministry Assistant Deputy Minister

## change request is the exchange of a standard replacement with another eligible vehicle on a ministries replacement plan after the plan has been signed by the respective expenditure officer The new vehicle identified for replacement must meet all standard replacement criteria in order to be eligible for a change request Change requests require signatures in the following order Ministry Vehicle Coordinator or equivalent Fleet Management Services E Ministry Executive Director

## Emergency replacement is to replace a vehicle that has been written off in an accident Please refer to the Vehicle Operator s Manual for details on the RM process Emergency Replacements require signatures in the following order Ministry Vehicle Coordinator or equivalent Fleet Management Services E Ministry Director

## contingency replacement is an unplanned replacement that occurs upon a major mechanical failure in the current unit To be eligible for a contingency replacement the current vehicle must be out of warranty and require a major repair not part of routine maintenance such as a new engine or transmission Contingency Replacements require signatures in the following order Ministry Vehicle Coordinator or equivalent Service Alberta Fleet Management E Ministry Executive Director

## request for a seasonal vehicle rental from the Fleet Management Services FM Pool if available Seasonal Units can be requested for month to months Current costs and inventory for the Seasonal Pool are posted on the Fleet Management Services Share Point site Please contact your FM Program Coordinator for more information Seasonal Pool vehicle orders require signatures in the following order Ministry Vehicle Coordinator or equivalent FM E Ministry Executive Director
